noun.description: A pinprick; the action of pricking with a pin.
Figurative. A minor misfortune or irritation; petty and persistent goading or criticism.

adjective.description: That pricks like a pin; causing petty annoyance, irritating.

origin: Early 18th century; earliest use found in John Stevens (c1662–1726), translator and antiquary. From pin + pricking<br>late 19th century; earliest use found in Rosa Caroline Praed (1851–1935), novelist. From pinprick + -ing.
